It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, and it has evergreen leaves that are elliptical in shape. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous forests at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
